title: Disappearance Day of Srila Narottama Dasa | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | ISKCON Bangalore Sanga
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Out of compassion for the conditioned souls, Champaka Manjari descended to earth as Narottam Das Thakur in the village of Kheturi in present-day Bangladesh around the mid-16th century.
segments.summary: Introduction to Srila Narottam Das Thakur, his spiritual identity as Champaka Manjari, and his descent to earth.

segments.key_quote: Even as a child, Narottama demonstrated profound devotion during his Annaprashana ceremony, he refused to eat until the food was first offered to Lord Krishna, thus teaching the sanctity of Prasadam.
segments.summary: Description of Narottam Das Thakur's birth, childhood, early signs of devotion, and growing detachment from material life.

segments.key_quote: Srila Jeeva Goswami introduced Narottama to Shri Loknath Goswami. Narottama humbly fell at his feet and Loknath Goswami moved by his sincerity blessed him and later agreed to initiate him.
segments.summary: Narottam Das Thakur's journey to Vrindavan, meeting with various Goswamis, receiving initiation, and becoming renowned for his scholarship and devotion.

segments.key_quote: The songs of Narottama Das Thakur are spiritual thunderbolts that crack open the heart. They descend directly from the spiritual world.
segments.summary: Emphasis on the power and importance of Narottam Das Thakur's songs and writings, and his role as a leading teacher in the Gaudiya Vaishnava movement.

segments.key_quote: Narottama remained compassionate, embracing everyone equally and demonstrating that spiritual qualification is measured by devotion not by birth.
segments.summary: Narottam Das Thakur's organization of the Keturi Mahotsava, his acceptance of disciples from all castes, his compassionate nature, and the miraculous nature of his disappearance.
